docs.snippet: Travis Hafner and the Yankees agreed to a $2 million, one-year contract that allows him to earn up to $4 million more in bonuses....
docs.lead_paragraph: Travis Hafner and the Yankees agreed to a $2 million, one-year contract that allows him to earn up to $4 million more in bonuses.
docs.abstract: New York Yankees and designated hitter Travis Hafner agree to one-year, $2 million contract.

docs.snippet: Baseball officials and law enforcement officers are investigating anti-aging clinics in Florida and the work of Anthony Bosch. The clinics might be linked to players and the possible use of banned substances....
docs.lead_paragraph: Baseball officials and law enforcement officers are investigating anti-aging clinics in Florida and the work of Anthony Bosch. The clinics might be linked to players and the possible use of banned substances.
docs.abstract: Baseball officials and law enforcement officers are trying to penetrate often opaque world of anti-aging clinics, which have proliferated in Miami area and have become linked to some of sport's biggest stars; former partner of Revive Miami founders, is at center of growing baseball doping scandal.

headline.seo: Baseball Officials Navigate Puzzle of Anti-Aging Clinics
headline.main: Baseball Officials Navigate Puzzle of Anti-Aging Clinics
headline.print_headline: Baseball Officials Navigate Puzzle of Anti-Aging Clinics

byline.contributor: Steve Eder and Lizette Alvarez reported from Miami, and Michael S. Schmidt from Washington. Alain Delaquérière contributed research from New York.
byline.original: By STEVE EDER, LIZETTE ALVAREZ and MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT

docs.snippet: Williams won the National League’s rookie of the year award in 1971, but was out of major league baseball by the end of the decade....
docs.lead_paragraph: Williams won the National League’s rookie of the year award in 1971, but was out of major league baseball by the end of the decade.
docs.abstract: Earl Williams, catcher and infielder who won the National League rookie of the year award in 1971 but whose promise went unfulfilled amid a welter of minor controversies, dies at age 64.

headline.seo: Earl Williams, an Ambivalent Baseball Star, Dies at 64
headline.main: Earl Williams, Baseball Slugger, Dies at 64
headline.print_headline: Earl Williams Dies at 64; Ambivalent Baseball Star

docs.snippet: The California Institute of Technology hadn't won a game in nearly 10 years....
docs.abstract: The California Institute of Technology hadn't won a game in nearly 10 years.

docs.snippet: At a time when concern is mounting about football-related injuries, at least 29 high school athletic associations permit full-contact practices in the off-season....
docs.abstract: At a time when concern is mounting about football-related injuries, at least 29 high school athletic associations permit full-contact practices in the off-season.

headline.main: Many High Schools Still Allow Full-Contact Practices in Off-Season

docs.snippet: Federal prosecutors said a Memphis educator paid teachers to take qualifying exams for others in three states who were afraid they would not pass....
docs.lead_paragraph: Federal prosecutors said a Memphis educator paid teachers to take qualifying exams for others in three states who were afraid they would not pass.
docs.abstract: Memphis educator Clarence D Mumford pleads guilty to charges that he was cheating ring mastermind, during his 23-year career, in which he paid teachers to take national teacher certification exams for others;  case rattles Memphis at time when city's schools are merging with suburban district, exposing tensions over race and economic disparity.

headline.seo: Teachers Accused of Cheating on Qualifying Exams
headline.main: In a Memphis Cheating Ring, the Teachers Are the Accused
headline.print_headline: In a Memphis Cheating Ring, the Teachers Are the Accused

byline.contributor: John Branston contributed reporting from Memphis, and Alain Delaquérière from New York.

docs.snippet: Chuck Hagel’s grilling as nominee for defense secretary was striking in a place where respect for fellow and retired senators of the same party has been more or less a given....
docs.lead_paragraph: Chuck Hagel’s grilling as nominee for defense secretary was striking in a place where respect for fellow and retired senators of the same party has been more or less a given.
docs.abstract: Chuck Hagel struggles with Senate Republicans' grilling during hearing for his nomination as defense secretary; willingness of Republicans to skewer one of their own shows how old ways of Senate, in which respect for fellow and retired senators of same party was more or less a given, are disappearing.

headline.main: In Senate, Traditional Decorum Gives Way to New Discord
headline.print_headline: In Hidebound Senate, Decorum Becomes Less Traditional

docs.snippet: 49ers Coach Jim Harbaugh can convey boredom, surprise, happiness and contempt with his facial contortions....
docs.lead_paragraph: 49ers Coach Jim Harbaugh can convey boredom, surprise, happiness and contempt with his facial contortions.
docs.abstract: San Francisco 49ers coach Jim Harbaugh's dynamic facial expressions will be on full display when team faces Baltimore Raven in Super Bowl XLVII.

headline.seo: Jim Harbaugh Says It All Without a Word
headline.main: Saying It All Without a Word
headline.print_headline: Rubber Soul: The Many Faces of Jim Harbaugh
